intro: Microseris douglasii subsp. tenella, commonly known as the narrowleaf prairie crocus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the family Brassicaceae, characterized by its small, showy flowers and pungent odor. The plant typically grows in open, dry habitats such as prairies and rocky slopes. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and its flowers are usually pale yellow or white. It is a perennial herb that produces seed pods that split open to release its seeds.
